intro: Amphithalea ericifolia subsp. ericifolia, commonly known as the heath shrub, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and pine forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem, evergreen foliage, and a preference for cool, moist environments.
